alert.note: Alert for Stafford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 16 at 6:15PM CDT until July 16 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR STAFFORD COUNTY... At 613 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Ellinwood, moving south at 35 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR NORTHERN AND CENTRAL STAFFORD COUNTY. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 610 PM CDT, widespread significant tree damage was reported in Great Bend, KS. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... St. John, Stafford, Hudson, Seward, Radium, Zenith and Dillwyn. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is an EXTREMELY DANGEROUS SITUATION. This storm is producing widespread wind damage across southern Barton County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. This storm is producing destructive winds and large damaging hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
